inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: abdominal pain attack during the preceding 12 months

inclusion.criterion: at least 1 calcified stone greater than 4 mm in one of its axes in the cephalic or corporeal portion of the main pancreatic duct with upstream duct dilation
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: abdominal CT scan revealed acute edematous interstitial pancreatitis with enlarged common bile duct and intrahepatic duct confirming gall stone pancreatitis

inclusion.criterion: written informed consent obtained from the patient
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is a 41-year-old obese woman coming to the emergency room

exclusion.criterion: history of treatment of the pancreas using ESWL, endoscopy, or surgery
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: pancreatic collection greater than 2 cm in diameter at magnetic resonance or CT Scan
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: alkaline phosphatase levels greater than twice the upper limit of normal values or signs of cholangitis
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: lab studies are remarkable for high CRP (145)

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient is a 41-year-old obese woman

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Her pregnancy test is negative and she is not breastfeeding

notes: Patient has painful chronic pancreatitis, calcified stones in the main pancreatic duct, and written informed consent. No history of treatment using ESWL, endoscopy, or surgery, no pancreatic collection greater than 2 cm, normal alkaline phosphatase levels, above 18 years old, not pregnant or lactating.
